YummiDelish
Jeff Nelder on Serendipity, Mindfulness & Purpose, explaining “Tao of Yummi,” written by Jeff Nelder, artwork & edited by Amy Nelder. Web design by Kris Nelder.
Mar 1

Access Your Incomparable Cycle of Inspiration and Creativity

This Message Brought To You By The Authentic Value That’s Yours To Give

Comparing yourSelf to others is like trying to fill a black hole with dirt and a shovel…you won’t get very far. You’re always better off pursuing your own potential, rather than someone else’s. Your ultimate potential is to create the change you wish to see in each moment.
 
Just imagine the mass of distrust and anger out there. In the next moment, you could certainly choose to add to either mass, and help it grow.
 
Then again, consider the total mindfulness, generosity and compassion that exist as well. These are also ready to accept your contributions. It’s your choice, when you’re mindful.
 
Everyone’s been there. Super busy. Moving, fast as you can. Feeling like you’re behind. You’re diligent, just trying to do a good job. Then someone asks for time. Maybe it’s a colleague; maybe it’s a stranger in the street. Perhaps it’s your tiny son, simply asking if you’ll play with him. Whoever it is, you brush them off. “Sorry, too busy right now,” and you walk on by. These days, you’re practicing mindfulness. So maybe it occurs to you just after the fact, but then you think, “it’s too late,” and you’re busy anyway, so you keep going. Why’s it too late? You can go back. As soon as you realize. Maybe you’ll be asked for more time than you can give, but maybe it’ll be quick. Either way, you can change things. If asked for more than you can give, simply give what you can spare. It’s enough to create a moment of kindness and generosity. A moment by you. This is your potential.
 
People spend so much time trying to measure up to someone else. It distracts from “the work” you do to reach your own potential.
 
What is it that you want? Is it the wristwatch, or the time of your life? Is it the car or the confidence that you’re going places? You strive for a head and heart-space. All else is just symbolic. Instead of comparing yourSelf to others, compare your experience to what you want to experience, and make your moment.

It becomes effortless when you transform “the work” into that which sustains you, so that walking the path becomes joyous inspiration rather than tedious perspiration.

Take Heart and Make Valentines Meaningful

Transform Valentine time into something more meaningful than symbolic and draft a memo to take heart in yourSelf. The Way of the Master is your way if you’re open to it. The effortless way doesn’t mean that you stop doing “the work.” It becomes effortless when you transform “the work” into that which sustains you, so that walking the path becomes joyous inspiration rather than tedious perspiration.

With each moment you make, you’re contributing to a change and adding to the net total of what you produce. What do you want to see in the world? More mindfulness? What about kindness and generosity? Now is your opportunity, so make more. Living into purpose, you’re producing. Mindful in the moment, you’re able to observe what you produce. Seeing your vision manifest, you’re inspired to create more.

Let’s take it a layer of benefit deeper. You create memories that you wouldn’t change when you’re purposeful and mindful. These are incomparable memories that uplift, rather than intractable recollections that plague with each replay. Here’s a Hallmark holiday transformation: instead of buying cards, create incomparable memories with your loved ones. If you have kids create all those valentines with your kids. You can imagine how it feels. Want to play with me mommy? Sure, let’s play a game of creation.

That’s SOME game of value creation you play — incomparable memories on one level, and tactile communications to inspire smiles, and more, on another. Be it ever so humble, you’re adding inspiration and creativity to the universe. This is the type of game that you cannot lose. Play your own game, the value creative game.

Imagine all the forms a creative space can take for you. See it open up in more situations and you’ll simply be opening up yourSelf.

Bring Singular Expertise to Authentic Value

Love, inspiration and creativity are a cycle that belongs to you and everyone, if only you’re open to it, no matter what area of expertise you’ve developed or natural abilities you’re grateful to have. Find the incomparable way to create the authentic value that’s yours to give everyday.

Beethoven created incomparable music, despite the loss of hearing. Some even suggest that Beethoven’s independence from the sound increased the profound nature of his work. Ask a trained musician, and you’ll learn that Beethoven heard the music from the pages he wrote in his head, without having to hear it played, like you hear words from books when you read them. You know how deeply you can feel the words and emotion of a good book.

When you think about living into purpose, becoming mindful in the moment, and opening to the delightful and unexpected, consider that Beethoven wrote his 9th symphony on the floor, having removed the legs of his piano so that he could feel the vibrations.

Time devoted to comparing apples and oranges is time away from inspiration and creativity. Your authentic value is exactly this — yours to give.

There’s a singular expert. Only one person’s experienced all the moments that created you. What does your authentic value look like when you envision it? You’re the one who knows how to do this. Once you see it, then you can take the next step. Open to your singular expertise.

Find Your Doorway to Sustainable Inspiration

It doesn’t get any grander or more celebrated than the Sistine Chapel, but purpose doesn’t have to be grand to produce what’s worthwhile. Michelangelo’s work has inspired the world for centuries — but self-sustainable inspiration requires direct experience, and will be powered by you. “For the sake of all,” refers to you as well.

In service of generating the change you wish to see in the Universe, learn how to access the inspiration that unlocks your creative cycle. You are this spiritual doorway to the Universe.

Look outwards, and your vision encounters physical limitation. Look inwards, and see through the lens of your authentic nature. True compassion for others, where giving becomes receiving, starts with yourSelf. Forgive yourSelf and let go of the fear and anger over previous decisions. Know compassion at the deepest level and you’ll open up to a state of compassion for others beyond the merely intellectual. Where compassion runs deep, inspiration isn’t far behind.

Want to observe inspiration? If you have children, learn from them. They effortlessly dwell on joy and love. It’s the source of their relentless creativity and resilience.

Fix a child’s toy and you can create an incomparable memory that’s worth a lifetime. See what it feels like when you duct tape that remote control car back together. If you don’t have kids, what about fixing the dishwasher? The entire world can fall away in those moments — and you don’t feel compelled to enumerate the problems. Instead, quietly celebrate the solutions sparked by the inspiration you find.

Facing Forward Is Facing Into Opportunity

The value you create, whatever form it takes, is worthwhile. As long as it’s purposeful. Especially, when you’re mindful. We all need you doing it. You’re here to help.

You’re an essential expression of the Universe. It runs that deep with you, so do what you do. Your integrity is who you are. As Dorothy famously said, “there’s no place like home,” and you’re at home in the creative space. Especially when you inject the authentic value that’s yours to give. Entering the creative space is better than going through a physical doorway. Go through a physical door and you enter or exit a room. Enter the creative space and you access a head and heart space where things make sense. Fear doesn’t have a place here. It’s got its own cycle.

You don’t have to be a prisoner to fear. Break out of that cycle. Let something else in. You don’t need to cut yourself off from feeling — you need to keep feeling, without getting distracted by fear. Feel more. Go past the fear and deeper into the moment. Become mindful to feel more without getting carried away. Let it all inspire you. Look for the positive image as well as the negative image.

Inspiration is like a snowball rolling downhill. The more inspired you become, the more creative you get. Just remember, you can find inspiration, but you must practice “yes, and…” Open the door to see what’s there.

Instead of being fearful, get ready, every stimulus that comes in is another opportunity. You can choose to fear it, or you can see it coming and instead of fearing it, look for what you can learn. Look for the good that you can do. You’re in the right space, traveling in the right direction. Whichever way you face is forward and into opportunity. Know what you really want, because you’re creating it, moment by moment.

There’s A Creative Space for Everything You Need

…and the creative space can be whatever you want it to be.

It can be an emotional creative space that you achieve so that you don’t attach to resentment, when you hold onto things after you know it does you no good. Why hold onto bad feelings just to fight and make yourSelf feel bad? See the potential in becoming open and curious.

Imagine all the forms a creative space can take for you. See it open up in more situations and you’ll simply be opening up yourSelf. Things work in combination with each other, becoming a whole greater than the sum of its parts.

Living into purpose, mindful in the moment, you open to the delightful and unexpected. This is also the creative space. A place where things begin to make sense. Fear holds no sway here, though love, inspiration and respect are everywhere. Serendipity, it’s simply a road sign telling you you’re still traveling the path you intended.

Be it ever so humble, there’s no place like home…and no authentic value like that which is yours to give. Here’s the beauty of it — just like gravity means that what goes up must come down…you’re always facing forward into the opportunity to live into purpose and observe it unfold mindfully, in the current moment. That’s Serendipity too.

…AND, oh yeah…

If this piece has value for you, I’d be honored if you’d recommend it by love-tapping that ole heart down there. You’ll be making it possible for others to take part in your orientation.

Thanks for your time and energy here today!

This is Tao of Yummi, Sutra 52. We publish the full 6-frame strip of conscious cartoonery, once a week, here on The Coffeelicious.

The Tao of Yummi is a serial conscious cartoon strip about finding your way to the delightful and unexpected through purpose and mindfulness. If you’re living into purpose and mindful in the moment, you’ll open to the infinite love, inspiration and creativity that is already yours.

Infinite love and gratitude to the muses in my life, as ever, to Kris Smith, @Amy Nelder, Peter Rutter, Jan Kadrie, Kaleo Sallas, Meika Cooper, Laura Hoffman, Joni Woolard, Korbin von Stentzsch, Malia Henriks, Alex Tanassi, Rose McNenny Schmoller, Ben Cooper, Danna Colman, Srinath, Neal Gorenflo, John Heinsen, Glase Lomond, Derek Sivers, Jay Lauf, Max Schorr, Ben Goldhirsh, Casey Caplowe and Amy Jo Martin!
